Pre-Game Insights: The New York Mets (73-64) will host the Boston Red Sox (70-67) at Citi Field in Queens, New York, for the first game of a three-game series.
The Mets have a 7-3 record in their last ten games, with a solid.249 batting average and a 3.10 ERA.
The Red Sox are struggling, going 3-7 in their last ten, with a disappointing.199 batting average and a 3.24 ERA.
The Mets' offense has been led by Brandon Nimmo, who has accumulated 18 home runs this season, and Francisco Lindor, who is hitting.302 over the last ten games.
The Red Sox feature Ceddanne Rafaela, with a powerful lineup that includes Jarren Duran, who has also been hot lately.
The Mets will start Luis Severino, who has a 9-6 record with a 3.96 ERA and a 1.26 WHIP.
Brayan Bello will take the mound for the Red Sox. Bello's 4.66 ERA indicates he has had challenges in keeping runs off the board.
The Mets' bullpen has been mostly reliable this season, with depth that allows them to manage leads effectively.
The Red Sox bullpen has shown inconsistency, which could be a decisive factor in this matchup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is set to begin at 7:10 p.m. EDT on Monday night.
